reviewText:
I'm going to do this review over again.

Pros: The Screenshots looks great.

Cons: Looks can be deceiving

* Hud is out of this world, way too much crap on the screen *
* I have no idea how to even attack someone, yea its that damn confusing*
* Music is horrible*
* There's no practice mode*
* No VS AI mode/Bots *
* Cash shop is all over the place*

I don't recommend this game. SoulCraft looks better , So I'm going to check that out soon.

reviewText:
Oh god. This game made my eyes hurt.

You can tell that this game was made for a mobile device. It was ported to steam with absolutely zero care. The controls alone made this game unplayable on pc. The gameplay itself is bad on its own right. The screen is heavily cluttered and is from what i can tell not customizable. The attack command is left click, which by it self isnt all that bad. Untill you realize the only way to move your character is to hold down the right mouse button and pretend your trying to use a touchscreen.

This was a terrible pc experience.

reviewText:
AHAHAHAHA oh my god this is honestly the worst game I've ever played.
The interface is absolutely abysmal and navigating to the options menu almost gave me a heart attack cos I was laughing that much.
The sound effects for each and every goon are similar to what I imagine a muffled underwater fart and/or burp to sound like.
And regardless of your rig this game runs at a solid 3.5 frames per second, and I'm pretty sure my old gameboy could play this.
But the controls really take the cake, hands down the worst ive encountered, it's like playing Unreal Tournament with a joystick or World of Warcraft with a steering wheel.
I can't get over how you can make a game this bad; I just wish it was published by EA and had day one DLC to really say ♥♥♥♥ you consumers".
I'd recommend checking it out for 10 minutes just so you can laugh at the sound effects (dat dragon monk makes some weird ♥♥♥♥in noises man)
"-10/10 won't install again"- IGN"

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wpTNnftzcDY
Kindergarden version out of League Of LegendsWhile i think the game has decent graphics and nice support for gamepads there is lot of stuff that is not that great. One point that i really have to adress is the fact of very poorly made audio on abilities and voices of the characters, it was pretty awful so i had to mute the game. The game could have more ingame tutorials for beginners (you can find them from youtube though).

The Cross platform thing is neat, but there is no way it can be balanced, people from PC will have edge over phone and tablet users and for that reason i think the game will never be in perfect balance.

HoS is not super bad game or anything, i just simply think that there are better MOBA's to play right now.

reviewText: Mostly Negative"\nI know when I see that
date:
I just have to try the game out so I can revel in its mediocrity.

But that wasn't the case with this game so let me explain why it has mostly negative reviews first and then if this game is for you.

The game controls (with a keyboard and/or mouse) like ♥♥♥♥. There is no getting around it
recommended: it was designed with touch screens and controllers in mind
hoursPlayed:
not for keyboard and mouse and CERTAINLY not for solo mouse!
If you dont have (or are unwilling to use) an xbox controller (or similar) then you can stop reading now and walk away from this game. You will not enjoy it at all!

Its shocking really to have a PC port that wasn't designed for PC in the slightest
voteText: but look a little deeper and you can figure out why. Cross platform? yup
helpfulPercent: you know what that means. Mobile-port
votesHelpful:
the bane of Steam users everywhere.
Not helping is the fact that the game is a chinese development team so communication with the dev team is just not going to happen.

That aside however the game is designed from the bottom up to be casual friendly and in doing so it accidently solved many of the flaws that the more hardcore MOBA games have. I have put years into MOBA type games and by design they are meant to obsfucate new players. This means they have to ask others for help or they have to play with friends. That is the design philosophy behind League of Legends and don't take my word for it as a google search shows many people feel the same way and Riot Games themselves have gone on record to say that is how they intended the game to be.

Defense of the Ancients* was a huge success and League of Legends is a huge commercial success and so every other MOBA just copied what they did and like Flappy Birds
votesTotal: we now have a saturated market. Heroes of Soulcraft is just another MOBA in that ocean of MOBA games however if you have never played a MOBA before this one does everything for you. Well
votesFunny: it doesn't explain what it is doing or why but
column18: because I could talk about LoL all day but you are curious if this game is for you and the answer is
column19: do you like arcade games? Completely by accident and by virtue of doing everything for you
column20: Heroes has boiled down the MOBA experience to its simplist form and believe it or not
column22: with a controller.\n\nBased on the negative reviews I'm not going to lie
column23: I expected an absolute train wreck and if you are looking for flaws then trust me
column24: the game has lots of them! The interface is a mess
column25: a few things that are important to us MOBA players IE how much +speed does this item give? vs that item? are just completely missing
column26: leading you to just guess and if you were wondering
column27: buying from the shop is automatic. Before you flip your desk and walk away however this goes back to my earlier comment "its simplist form" because if you can navigate the bizaare in game menus you can actually pre-define what you buy from the shop and what order you buy it in
column28: per hero! There is also nothing stopping you from turning the option off and manually buying items as well or from buying
column30: by visiting the shop like most MOBA games.\n\nThey had some fantastic ideas
column31: going into this game and I really think a lot of them were accidental and I wish
column33: that LoL will look at some of the things Heroes~ is doing.\n\nIf you want to get into MOBA games but LoL was too complicated for you then this is THE game for you bar none
column34:
although I hear Heroes of the Storm is casual friendly too*.

If you like the other MOBA offerings then there is nothing to see here apart from controller support.

If you don't know what a MOBA is then give this game a try and see if the genre is for you
column35:
although I recommend picking up DOTA or LoL if you do infact like the genre.

*Thanks to Nebulous & Tibbers for corrections.

column39: 52 of 103 people (50%) found this review helpful 14 people found this review funny

reviewText: It's what says in the description: ARCADE MOBA meaning it's not hardcore,nor for veteran players, and exactly from them you will find all the negative reviews. It is a fun and easy introduction to the (mostly hard to get into) world of MOBA games. If you always wondered about games like Dota2 or League of Legends but getting into each of them seemed intimidating this is a game for you. Also if you wanted to try MOBA games but prefer to game on a controller this is a game for you as well. The support for mouse and keyboards is not that great since this is a cross-platform game with a mobile game but on the positive side, you can always find someone to play with since there is a lot (a lot) of people playing (and loving) this game on Android.\n\nAll in all, casual and fun MOBA, made for controllers, big in the world of mobile games, despised amongst the hardcore MOBA crowds on Steam.

reviewText:
Here we go...

PROS:
-Easy as hell to play
-Full controler support
-$30.00 and you can unlock everything or you can just earn in game currency
-Anyone can run this game
-Can also be played on your phone or tablet
-No one bashes you for being bad at the game or for being new to it

CONS:
-Can only qeue with 2 people to a party
-Only to game types. (2v2 and 4v4)

That's about it really. This game isn't as bad as everyone makes it out to be. Yeah, the graphics aren't the best, so what. The gameplay isn't bad. The games are fast paced, ranging from 5-15 minutes a piece. Every character is pretty fun to play. I have yet to find a character I can't play.

Just give the game a try before you judge it based on all the negative reviews. Have a nice day and thanmks for reading. :D

reviewText:
If you're looking for a review you've come to the wrong place, if you're here to cook a pie then read on !
Napoleon from the final puff pastry
You will need:
Ready flaky pastry - 1.5 kg five eggs Flour - 150 g> Sugar - 400 grams Milk - 1200 ml Vanilla sugar - 1 n. Cognac - 1 tbsp. l. Shelled walnuts - glass sequence of preparation: dough defrost naturally at room temperature (defrost time indicated on the package). Cook the custard: grind the egg yolks with a mixer or a whisk to a conventional incandescent and vanilla sugar, flour and brandy to enter the mix. The mixture pour a trickle of milk, stir and cook, stirring constantly. Divide the dough into the desired number of pieces that will later Korzh. Roll out each piece on a board sprinkled with flour. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes until golden color on a dry baking temperature of 200 degrees. Fluff the cooled cream cakes. If desired, each layer sprinkled with chopped nuts. On top of the cake lightly press smeared with cream and sprinkle all sides crumbs. Add layer cake in a cool place overnight.

reviewText: Although it lacks a stand-alone training mode (you are given helpful tips and instruction throughout the match) and doesn't really explain it's unique mechanics and currency system, you wouldn't even notice once you dive in and play. It's a pretty straight forward MOBA with the same standard setup: Unique characters that are fun to play and easy to pickup, 2-lane battlefield with turrets and minion waves (I've only ever seen 2),  complete with small jungles scattered, and a core at the end for you to wack and blast until you win. As a long time MOBA fan who has played most if not all of em', I have alot of fun playing this. Sure, it's not littered with secondary objectives like most others in the genre, but what it lacks in meta game, it makes up for in just pure, pick-up-and-play fun. This, along with the fact that the toxicity and trash talk that you experience in other moba's are non-existent,  makes it accessible to even those new to the genre. Also, while I'm perfectly capable of using a keyboard and mouse, It's nice that you're able to use a controller as well! At the end of the day, you have nothing to lose by trying it for yourself no matter what the reviews say... positive or negative.

reviewText:
I honestly cannot see where the negative reviews are coming from with this game.  While there is a lack of content, the game plays extremely well.

Character animations aren't flashy, but truly, they don't really need to be.  They look fine in my opinion.  The control of the game is rather good, playing with a controller for once in a moba besides Smite is a GODSEND.  It is amazing.

I will admit, there isn't truly much to the game, the music truly is kind of dull and sometimes I question if there is music at all, but all things aside, most people play their own music anyway when playing such games, though a soundtrack would have been appreciated.

The characters are rather interesting to look at, though the diversity is well appreciated.  I have to say, they are fun for what they have.

All in all, it's a good game, not fantastic, but certainly not terrible.

Would I recommend it?  Most likely, it's not for EVERYONE, but if you enjoy Smite, and LoL, this is certainly a game you should in the very least, play once or twice.

reviewText:
I honestly dont see why this game is getting so much hate, just because it was originally a mobile game.
The game plays just fine as you think a moba would, my review is probably biased because its the first moba that I've ever played that lets me use my 360 controller. From now on if a moba lets me use my controller that gives it so much more favor for me, yet the only other one I can think of is Smite but its godawful to play on pc with a controller, since it has absolutely zero help with onscreen controls like this game has. The hud lets you know which buttons to press on screen, you'd have to be an idiot not to understand it (With a controller). After playing my first 2 matches with my controller just fine, won both. There are some cons to the game nonetheless that I hope could get patched later on

Cons:
-The button to teleport back home is the same button to use an item that you just bought, resulting in just plain wasting the item if you accidently press the button 4 damn times without thinking Gaahhh >_<
-Seperate the button configurations for the above problem for the love of god, I really want to like this game.
-Controls are customizable" but not to the point where I can just easily fix the above problem.
-The item shop that requires this "gold" is a little unorthodox. it can use player gold
date: or current ingame gold you've accumulated during the game. Not sure if this player gold can be bought with real world money. Gold accumulation is a little on the slow side.\nPros:\n-Works with a controller
recommended: hands down my favorite way to play a moba ever.\n\nThis is my first review that I'd ever make
hoursPlayed: I never thought I'd ever need to make a review but since this game is wrongfully getting alot of hate
voteText: I figure I'll share my thoughts.\nI'd rate this game a solid 7 out of 10"

reviewText: I don't know how this can get so many bad reviews... I looked for a game with controller support and I was happy to find the first MOBA with controller support. So that's the biggest difference between our reviews, since all previous reviewers complained about bad PC keyboard controls. Secondly it is FREE TO PLAY, what quality do you expect from an FTP experimental MOBA game?\nI think this is a pretty fun game, obviously you can't take it as seriously as League of Legends for example, but it seems fun and very light for a little break between work/school or something else that keeps you busy. I also think it has quite some potential considering the full controller support, which is not usual for MOBAs.

reviewText: Took me 10 seconds to get into my very first match, gamepad worked perfectly, fun simple gameplay, easy as hell to learn, not a dime spent, won...awesome! Confirmed NOT p2w! Full gamepad support MOBA, what more can you ask for? I mean seriously, its about time we get more MOBAs with gamepad support, this game proves its not hard to have that feature.\n\nBasic graphics, simple, fun aimed at casual gamers. Has all the features that are in most other MOBAs such as item shop, level progression, abilities, towers, creeps, etc...A much faster paced MOBA with my match lasting about 10 min. Kids will complain thats its not DOTA or LOL but its FREE (not p2w) so give it a shot. Stop complaining like you actually paid money for this game. With Arcade" in the title
date: don't expect a super detailed or super in depth MOBA.\n\nSo many butthurt people. Hating on a free game that they played for 10 min...At least give it an actual chance before you mindlessly spew haterd for the game. Not sorry its not LoL or DOTA."

reviewText:
Great game if I would play it on my old PC. But I would cuz it still eats quite alot for such thing
Game have horrible design, no description, no helper and annoying guides. Everything is so huge but still useless.
No proper UI.
I see that this game was ment to be played on tablets, but many things are bad.

One and only good part is that you can be assigned to already stated game. It acts like a lobby, So you almost always can play without waiting
----
Editing review: played it more trying to figure out many other aspects and now i think that game is actiualy much worse than it was for me before.
Players constantly lagging, if your team loses view poits you almost definetly will lose. Playing hight ranked always drops you with some new guys that constantly dying under enemy tower.
You can be dropped in game where view seconds left for you to lose... and you still get lose for this, minus huge rank penalty and 0 coins.
Your rank as player is actiually counted by wins no matter what (you lose - rank penalty, you win - probably a little plus to your rank).
All this alse can be for you oponent to. So game becames fully random. It's just random will you win or lose, will you get normal team member or your oponent, will game lag for you or your oponent.

So now game review is definetly negative!

reviewText: Played it now, a game that has been well played on Google Play, but when there are mobile games, some mobile games should stay mobile. I gotta say, the SoulCraft series was pretty okay, but i never got to play this one on mobile due to registration errors. Watching this game makes me gonna miss Solstice Arena, since Solstice Arena is going to shut down on august and i played it so much on my phone. But back to the topic, I played this game a bit with my gamepad, on gamepad it feels like it does have good potential, meanwhile it's a total train wreck trying to play this on mouse and keyboard. The graphics looks like it can run well on a potato, im not kidding because it runs more than 500 fps for me on my pc and i have not messed around with the graphics at all. The sound effects are very low quality, something you can expect from a mobile game and trust me there are more games like this on mobile that run a very low quality for a good speaker. The multiplayer itself is okay, but not really a fan of MOBA's here but it really makes other MOBA's look bad. It's not really a good game, but it has its potential.

reviewText: Having invested an hour into this game, i can safely say that there is no tangible way to play this game successfully. In no way or circumstance can one ever know in full what he is doing. it is as if his inputs are meaningless and the game runs itself. Movement is awkward, as if one has to turn it on and off. Fighting makes no sense; what even is in the damn store? I have no clue.\n\nStill, it's so bad that it's almost good. I would play it, but only if you want a cheap and rude laugh.

reviewText:
Not completly sure about recomend or not this game, so lets check its pros and cons:
+ Free and not pay-to-win.
+ Cross platform (Windows, Android, iOS). Actually I first played it on my android tablet (iPEGA-9700), so you can play it anywhere and anytime with a single account.
+ Matches can be quick. If you don't want to or don't have time for long matches you can play for 5min or 15 min matches.
+ Nice variety of heroes (not a lot). This can be good so you can find the ones that suits you faster.
+ Very accessible. If you're new to MOBAs or just want a lighter experience.
+ Best played with a Xbox360 controller.

- Terrible Mouse/Keyboard controls. Also I couldn't make x360ce work so just use an Xinput controller.
- Don't look for nice graphics or animations in here.
- Music and FX are not the best, but are not horrible.
- Unbalanced matches (sometimes). Sometime you're team will be full of low level players against really high level players making it totally unfair.
- Lag, sometimes. This is bad because the game doesn't seem to be complex so no idea why there's lag sometimes.

So for the big letdowns I'd say the terrbile MKB controls (considering this is a PC port), but probably having a proper configuration would be and advantage over the mobile gamers, so maybe that's the reason (or devs were just lazy).
But afterall is a nice ligth MOBA for guys like me that don't have too much time for big MOBAs like Dota2 or LOL and just want to kill some time and have a lightweight MOBA experience.

Just remember to USE an Xbox360 controller.
